title: Sands of time
caption: Sands of time
desc: At a quick glance, you might mistake these dunes for massive snowdrifts. Although they do make for great sledding, the tiny crystals that make up White Sands National Park in New Mexico, are not ice but gypsum, a soft mineral often used to make plaster and chalk. The pearly sands compose the largest gypsum dune field in the world but cover just a fraction of southern New Mexico's Tularosa Basin.
